intro: Hieracium petiolulatum, commonly known as the slender leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, producing a distinctive, showy display. Hieracium petiolulatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
